text: can you believe this can you believe it
the markets closed the dow is down over
650 points and Congress has turned down
at least for now the bailout plan I'm
not saying it's the perfect plan I'm not
saying it guarantees that everything
will be all right you know there I've
heard lots of ideas that might be better
they might be but it's what's on the
table it was hammered out in a
compromise it needs to pass because
there's nothing else between us and
financial Armageddon okay so these guys
are supposed to be our elected leaders
and not our elected followers it's
totally understandable that people in
the country would be angry at the extent
to which this feels like a wall street
bailout the extent to feel like we're
helping the rich guys evade the mistakes
they made but the truth is that if we
don't get the economy and Wall Street
back on his feet again the effects are
going to be long-lasting they're going
to be severe and they're going to affect
everybody what's been going on in
Congress the last few days as they've
battered battered about ideas about this
has been a race for political cover the
Democrats don't want to do it and be
exposed if it doesn't work the
Republicans don't want to sign on and
then have it not work so they're scared
just like we are they're scared for
their own reelection we're scared for
our ability to get a mortgage so you
know there are times when our elected
leaders need to actually act like
leaders this is one of those times
